title: SB 1.17.38 part 1 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 17-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
segments.summary: The session begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: Parikṣit Mahārāja gave permission to Kali to reside in a place where there is gambling, drinking, prostitution and animal slaughter were performed.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam describing the places where Kali, the personification of irreligion, is allowed to reside: gambling, drinking, prostitution, and animal slaughter.

segments.key_quote: religious principles there are four religious principles on which religion is based dharma is based
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the four places where Kali resides, explaining the meaning of each term and how they lead to irreligion and sinful activities, contrasting them with the four pillars of dharma: austerity, cleanliness, mercy, and truthfulness.

segments.key_quote: austerity is destroyed by pride cleanliness is destroyed by prostitution mercy is destroyed by intoxication and truthfulness destroyed by falsehood cheating lying propaganda
segments.summary: The speaker continues to explain how pride, prostitution, intoxication, and falsehood counteract austerity, cleanliness, mercy, and truthfulness, respectively, and how Kali is given permission to live in places where gambling, prostitution, drinking, and animal slaughter occur.

segments.key_quote: gambling destroys truthfulness because it is cheating it is falsity is falsehood then prostitution destroys cleanliness so illicit sex is the cause of Varna Sankara population
segments.summary: The speaker delves deeper into the consequences of gambling and prostitution, explaining how gambling is a form of cheating and how prostitution leads to Varna Sankara population, which results in the breaking of religious principles and criminal-mindedness.

segments.key_quote: animal slaughter killing animals destroys the quality of mercy only hard-hearted people cruel people people who are merciless they indulge in animal killing simply for the sake of satisfying their tongue by eating animal flesh.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how intoxication destroys austerity and how animal slaughter destroys the quality of mercy, emphasizing that meat-eaters are necessarily cruel and hard-hearted.

segments.key_quote: it is very very basic fundamental principle that we should understand
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reiterating that the principles discussed are fundamental and not tied to any specific belief system, and announces the continuation of the discussion in the next session.
